reviews.text: I order from here FREQUENTLY! Their lunch meals are so affordable and delicious and the quantity is great. I usually have leftovers for the next day. Definitely a regular spot for me.

Anytime I eat here or get take out the food is always great, from morning breakfast to dinner the food is comforting. When I get take out they always offer me seat if there‚Äôs seating available. As I‚Äôm waiting they gave me updates how long my food would take. This is always a must stop before my long drives home.

I mean I've been coming here for years, however the food is just not consistently good or well made...staff is mostly slow in taking orders, food has been cold several times and the last time I had a lemonade it tasted as if the lemons or limes were spoiled or just rotten...I can do without...sorry Caridad, but its just not the same over there (Woodhaven, Q location)

Great Dominican Spanish Creole. The food is tasty & fast. The lunch special extremely reasonable 7 bucks. The the empanadas are not so great but I guarantee you will love everything all the way down to the liver steak with onions. They also have fruit shakes natural. The staff is welcomeing, always with a smile.

This restuarant is pretty decent , the food is good and it's service is good. I had the mofongo and fresh squeezed orange juice which I believe they watered down and it kinda disappointed me but other than that I like their food

We had dined in at the restaurant I ordered a platter to try all of there meats let‚Äôs just say I left there throwing up with food poisoning the next couple days. I WARN YOU ALL THIS ESTABLISHMENT NOT ONLY HAS POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE BUT ARE SERVING DISEASES TO YOU ON A PLATE BE AWARE STAY AWAY AND DO NOT EAT FROM HERE I WILL BE REPORTING THIS RESTAURANT TO THE FDA AND NY FOOD AND HEALTH WERE WORKING ON GETTING THEM SHUT DOWN THIS PLACE IS KILLING PEOPLE.

Que tipo de omelette es este le ped√≠ con pimientos y me salen con esto, esta  s√∫per mal aparte la persona  que recibe las √≥rdenes uno le dice lo que quiere y el manda todo mal, y se le olvidan las cosas que uno quiere siempre es lo mismo con este restaurante y hoy fue mi ultima orden con ellos un Cliente menos

Stopped in to grab dinner to-go with my mom and niece.  There were three people sitting down, eating in the restaurant part, and no one at the back where you can order food.  We stopped for a second to see what they are serving and a lady asks us what we wanted to order.  We order, and with a rushed, stink attitude she takes our order.  She rushes to put our food on a plate, and barely gives us a second to ask for extra gravy before she is sealing the food!  Like I said before the place was not busy at all, so I was confused why she is rushing.  She takes our orders with an attitude, to the point where my 12 year old niece, says "what is her problem?"   She gave me three pieces of beef with my small order of beef stew!! Then low and behold, I order my food in Spanish and she has a look of shock on her face!!! Yes, I am African American, who knows some Spanish!!!  I'm not sure if she was treating us with an attitude because we were black, or because we didn't come in speaking spanish, or because that is simply her personality! Of course when she was handing us our food, she tried to smile, but I'm not tipping for poor service! The cashier, not sure if he was the manager was nice, and I wanted to tell him, how she was treating us, but I let it go, and we left.  This staff member needs to go to the Spanish restaurants in Corona or East Elmhurst, where they treat everyone the same, and are consistently nice to everyone!  Food was good, cashier was nice, but staff by the take-out area, needs to be nice!
Had the 3 golpes and it was very tasty! Would be back just for this.

This location has been going down hill. The food is still holding its value but the service has been on decline for a while now. The constant attitudes from the staff when placing an order to slow service when ordering inside. For me to get to this point has been a long time coming. But my advice if you don‚Äôt like your job people, go find something that makes you happy.  Won‚Äôt be going back anytime soon.

Got food poisoning from the food, especially the sancocho, chicken soup, meat smelled like raw animal and stale hard platano still recovering from sickness 3 days later. They are reusing/reheating old food.
Great food. Nice atmosphere. Had the western omelette. Good but they don‚Äôt have Jalape√±os here.
Very nice Dominican spot for all Dominican breakfast lunch and dinner clean environment good food

The food is ok but the service is horrible, I ordered some food for my Nee Year Eve  party . I place the order Saturday, for 6:00 o‚Äôclock Sunday . I called to confirm Sunday morning .  I got my food 2 hours later , mean while I call twice and they kept on telling me it was in its way since  6:30 I live 10 minutes away.  The food was cold when it arrived .  The rice wasn‚Äôt a full tray like I ask for. I promise myself I never order food from them again.

Caridad Restaurant is a hidden gem that‚Äôs as authentic as it is welcoming. With over three decades of serving vibrant Dominican dishes, Caridad‚Äôs reputation for quality and consistency is a reason for its customers. The moment you step inside, you‚Äôre wrapped in an aroma that feels like a warm hug from a familiar place. Their menu is thoughtfully curated with Dominican classics like pernil and mofongo, each with flavors that remind you of home, even if you‚Äôve never been to the Dominican Republic. Caridad‚Äôs commitment to quality is evident in every bite, with fresh ingredients and expert preparation ensuring a meal that‚Äôs as satisfying as it is flavorful. For anyone seeking a Dominican dining experience, Caridad Restaurant is the place to go, where the perfect reminder of Santiago's food is.
